newsitem.title: CHINA: China vows to scrap non-tariff measures for WTO.
newsitem.headline: China vows to scrap non-tariff measures for WTO.

text.p: China has promised to scrap its remaining non-tariff barriers to foreign imports within eight years as part of its attempt to gain entry to the World Trade Organisation, the China Economic Times said on Wednesday.

The vow to scrap all non-tariff measures that did not accord with WTO standards was made in Geneva on August 1 and was expected to have a positive effect on Beijing's chances of acceding to the global trade club, the official newspaper said.

The overwhelming majority of non-tariff measures would be eliminated within six years, while those affecting the remaining products, which would include automobiles, would be removed within eight years, it said.
Non-tariff measures currently affect 343 classes of imported goods, down from 1,247 in 1992, the newspaper said.

It quoted the chairman of China's WTO work group Ji Lade as saying the hard work put into Beijing's entry offer was reflected in amendments to its proposals on non-tariff measures and agricultural subsidies, but gave no further details.
